comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Bibliotheque Nationale de France site, Gallica has an Agence Meurisse photo which appears to be taken a little bit later at this same event, as the General is almost to the end of the line. Gallica's title: Le général Cousin décore des prisonniers russes aux Invalides, publication date 1915. gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b9043860c Another source, Paris en Images, has the photo Bain's seems to be cropped from, with the title, "Guerre 1914-1918. Décoration de soldats russes évadés d'Allemagne. Paris, Cour des Invalides, 1915." Indicating that the Russian soldiers had escaped from Germany. www.parisenimages.fr/fr/popup-photo.html?photo=913-13 I can't find much information on General Camille Cousin (1852 -1917), except that there are hundreds of pictures of him in the court of the Invalides in Paris decorating the wounded.
